document_data.name: Khamallan Teren
document_data.mainbody: '''Khamallan Teren''' was a [[proxy]] of the [[Faerûnian pantheon|Faerûnian]] [[power]] known as [[Malar]], who chiefly inhabited his [[divine realm]], the [[Land of the Hunt]].
document_data.Description: Khamallan was a very huge man with clawed hands, but could move his body with grace comparable to that of a [[mountain lion]].
document_data.Personality:
Khamallan was a very deceitful, evasive, overall dangerous and [[evil]] man. His only joys in life were hunting and the evisceration of his prey. He was willing to talk with others, though his eyes always measured people as if searching for the most devastating place to claw at them.

Khamallan showed absolute loyalty to Malar, never talking back to him or asking questions, and he reveled in gutting those who dared to do so. In general he took pleasure in tearing out the innards of his enemies.
document_data.Abilities: Being a proxy of Malar, a god of the hunt, Khamallan was quite skilled in tracking down his prey.
document_data.Possessions: This proxy possessed a ''[[power key]]'' that worked on all [[planes of existence]], an item that was gifted to him by his deity Malar.
document_data.Relationships: Khamallan was infamous among the inhabitants of the Land of the Hunt and those in the wider [[plane]] of [[Carceri]]. Whenever he went hunting in the canyons of [[Colothys]] or the shallows of [[Porphatys]] other proxies would hide, [[petitioner]]s would flee in terror, and even the [[gehreleth]] would do their best to steer clear of him.
